titlestmt.titleproper: Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center records

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:12:10 -0400.

did.unittitle: Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center records

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administrative records, correspondence and exhibition files, and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Loan: Administrative records, 1919-1974, including the Memorandum of Affiliation and Resolutions (1926) whereby the Broadmoor Art Academy became the Arts Department of Colorado College, Colorado Springs; files, 1925-1955, of Broadmoor Art Academy Director Stanley Stoner and Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center Directors Stanley Lothrop, Paul Parker, Mitchell A. Wilder, and James B. Byrnes containing correspondence with artists and organizations, financial records, annual reports, insurance reports, price lists, exhibition lists, membership lists, clippings, exhibition catalogs, press releases, art school applications, contracts, and photographs; exhibition files, 1945-1955, containing correspondence, lists of artists participating in exhibitions, artists' biographies, installation lists, price lists, drafts of catalog essays, shipping receipts, invoices, loan forms, clippings, exhibition announcements and catalogs, press releases, and photographs of works of art; calendars of events, 1936-1958, and exhibition catalogs for "New Accessions USA," 1946-1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Annual reports, 1970 and 1976; corporate reports, 1981 and 1982; a Governor's Award program, 1979; decorative arts catalog from the Golden Gate Exposition, 1939; 11 biennel catalogs, 1950-1972; and miscellaneous catalogs.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 3215-3234, 3295-3297, and 3459-3461 available for use through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded 1919 as the Broadmoor Art Academy by Mr. And Mrs. Spencer Penrose. The Academy became affiliated with Colorado College in 1926 and was reincorporated as the Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center in 1936.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1984-1985, as part of the Archives of American Art's Texas project. Unmicrofilmed material was donated 1984 by Fred Bartlett, former director of the Center.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Finding aid is available at Archives of American Art offices.
